title: Boris Johnson news live: Brexit updates as PM sparks fury with 'outrageous' plan to ignore parliament
text:
Boris Johnson is travelling to Dublin for his first official meeting with the Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar, before he returns to the Commons for a second vote on a snap general election.

It comes as the prime minister sets up a possible showdown in the Supreme Court after it emerged No 10 is ready to launch a legal fight against the anti-no deal legislation.

Mr Johnson is also reportedly ready to send a second letter to the EU – alongside the request for a three-month Brexit delay required of him – explaining he does not actually want any delay after 31 October. Labour figures branded the scheme “illegal” and “monumentally ridiculous”.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.
description: Boris Johnson is travelling to Dublin for his first official meeting with the Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar, before he returns to the Commons for a second vote on a snap general election. It comes as the prime minister sets up a possible showdown in the Supreme Court after it emerged No 10 is ready to launch a legal fight against the anti-no deal legislation.
